text: Bottle. Pours black with a small tan head. great lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and chocolate. Flavor was smooth and creamy with roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla, roasted coffee, caramel and a touch of cream.

12-ounce bottle pours black with ruby hues. Moderately dark-tan creamy head. Aroma: molasses, raisins, dark chocolate. Flavor: raisins, figs, dates, molasses, smokiness from roasted black patent malt, espresso latte¬í. Mouthfeel: smooth, creamy from lactose.
Stout muy especial, tiene los aromas t√≠picos de cualquier stout, sorprendiendo en el sabor.

Una Stout que √©s bona, i que si no fos per la baixa graduaci√≥ seria una Imperial Stout en quant a cos i sabor. T√© gust a licor de caf√© i el sabor de les Imperial Stout envellides. T√© cos mig/alt. De color negre nit. Fa escuma baixa, amb bombolla petita. Amargor nul¬∑la, √©s gaireb√© dol√ßa. Olor a licor de caf√® i xocolata. Recomanable.

Pitch black and incredible smooth and unctuous. I was drinking this with other stouts so any aromas or nuanced flavors were really lost for me. Disappointing but I would like to try this again on its own.
on tap pours black with tan headtaste isbalanced between chocolate and coffee flavors.

Ar: Cocoa and light char, a touch of smoke; cherry and blueberry notes, some sweet coffee. Ap: Deep brown-black, opaque; small tan head with low retention, leaves a ring of bubbles and a thin cap of foam with a big middle sud. T: Sweet, cocoa and coffee up front; light herbal bitterness; medium caramel and sweet bread crust; nice toasted malt finish. P: Medium body with medium-high carbonation; finish is moderately dry. O: Excellent sweet stout; nice blend of roast and caramel flavors--very multidimensional--with a well-balanced sweetness.
Bottle pour at home. Black pour thin head, semisweet chocolate aroma little coffee, almost nitro like body, rosted coffee and coco, smooth drinking beer.
Power milk aroma with a caramel cream body velvety finish with a bit of coca.

Bottle. Bottled Jan 2014; Drank Apr 2015 - Opaque Black in colour. Short lived thin tan head. Malty; dark chocolate, lightly roast malts, some coffee, caramel. Creamy and smooth. Sweet dark chocolate and light roast malts throughout. Quite dry into the finish. Decent, but I expected more. (2015-04-09)
Creamy smooth, very roasty. Mouth feel is nice and thick, overall quite balanced between chocolate and coffee flavors. very nice beer.

Pours black with a brown head. Nose of roasted malt. Taste is some bittersweet chocolate, and a really smoky bitter finish. I don't love the smokiness. Makes it tough to really like the beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 355ml. A dark beer with minimal head. Aroma is lf blac coffee and lactose. Taste is very sweet with low bitterness. Medium bodied with fizzy carbonation and a lactose finish. Feels like black coffee with milk and sugar.

Bottle, 355ml. Opaque dark brown, frothy light brown. Aromas of roasted malts, coffee, dark fruits, lactose, light alcohol. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation. Medium sweet, lightly bitter. Sweet roasted and coffee flavors into an acidic lactose finish. Smooth and pleasant.

Where: Old Line Fine Wine Spirits & Bistro. 
How: 12 ounce bottle.
Appearance: pours an opaque black with just a touch of brown at the edge when held to the light. One finger of thick, foamy tan head. Not much retention.
Aroma: Strongest note in the aroma is coffee, followed by half and half, and then some melted chocolate.
Taste: Both coffee and half & half are equally strongest here, followed by some lingering acidity, and semi-sweet bitter chocolate chips. The finish is heavy on burnt barley and light smoke. 
Palate: Wet to start, then creamy, and dries out considerably. Roasted, dry finish. 
Overall: One of the smoothest easiest drinking stouts, I¬íve had in a while.

I don¬ít know how this beer is rated as highly as it is in here. I am very unimpressed. One of those beers where I bought a six pack just to try something new and as soon as I took a sip thought "that was a mistake, should have just bought another unibroue." Watery, no character at all. All you taste is malt and not a very pleasant malt flavor at that. In the same class with Guinness as far as I¬ím concerned. Might even prefer a Guinness and that¬ís saying something.

Pours black with small brown head. Aromas of chocolate and malt. Taste the same with a little sweetness from the cream. Very smooth. Little to no aftertaste. Finishes clean. Nice lacing in the glass. Light to medium mouth feel.
Bottle. Black color, small brown head. Aroma has milky notes, coffee, cream. Nice roasty body, cream notes, milky notes, latte. Very nice.
Bottled. Fantastic stout. Pours black with off white lacing. Great malt aroma and smooth mouthfeel. I love that it isn¬ít too smokey.
Perfect stout. Not too heavy. No over powering flavors. Balanced and beautiful.
Bottled. Black body, small brown head. The aroma has hops, vanilla, coconut. The taste is not sweet at all, more like bitter chocolate.
black with a nice tan head; roasted malt aroma with chocolate notes; nice creamy roasted malt flavor with chocolate notes; very smooth, just slightly sweet; mild espresso notes

Taste: Bold toasted bittersweet chocolate malt,smooth, smoked, dry. The same with the nose. Black/Brown in color, opaque, smaller cream colored head with delicate lace. Medium, almost full body. Creamy, not really sweet.

Bottle at home. Pours Dark brown with a tan head that leaves a lot of lacing. Slightly roasted aroma with coffee, cream, a bit of chocolate and some vanilla. Taste is similar. A little bit on the thinner side. Roasted finish.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupe≈Çniania profilu na ratebeer. BierCab. Really complex and Intense for 6% Stout.

On tap at Rattle N Hum East, Manhattan, New York, USA. A dark brown/ruby/black coloured pour with a healthy beige head on top. Sweet, malty, chocolate, vanilla aroma. Tastes similar, sweet, malty, chocolate, vanilla, hint of caramel. A rich and tasty stout from the superb Bell¬ís brewery.

Poured from the tap into a 20 oz. mug at Taco Mac in Atlanta, GA. The appearance is a dark brown to black color with a tan head. The aroma is roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. The taste is malt heavy with chocolate and raisins.. Another excellent beer from Bell¬ís

12oz bottle. 8/23/16 bottle date. Appearance: Black, opaque, with a low brown head that dissipates quickly. 
Aroma: Sweet chocolate, some bread crust, a light roasted coffee edge with a touch of cream. Overall aroma is low in intensity. 
Taste: Starts with bittersweet dark chocolate, followed by some bread crust, then turning to light coffee roast and moderate bitterness. 
Mouthfeel: Medium to heavy body with a velvety creaminess. Low carbonation. 
Finish: Leaves a dry, bitter, light roast. 
Overall: A very well balanced sweet stout that is a nice blend of chocolate, toast, and coffee with a creaminess that softens the roast and bitterness

Deep black with slight mahogany highlights, one-finger mocha head that dissipates quickly and oily lace. Aromas of roasted malts with dark bittersweet chocolate, wood and hints of dark fruit. Complex flavor profile starts with roasted malt that quickly gives way to bittersweet dark chocolate, powdered cocoa, and a dark fruit note. Burnt toast, roasted coffee and cream make appearances. Full body, minimal carbonation, slick mouthfeel and a bitter chocolate/coffee finish.
From Labirratorium. In Teku glass. Playing Magic duels. Pleasant smooth brew, without nothing standing out but nothing bad either. On the mild side without being flat.

Draught @ Churchkey, Washington, DC. Pours cloudy very dark brown with creamy,mstable light tan head. Clear aroma of roast, with notes of malt and yeast and touches of coffee. Sweetish, malty and estery flavour with touches of chocolate and notes if roast and coffee. Roasty and estery afteraste with bretty notes. Good.

Really nice sweet stout. Not fake sugary. Malts and bitter barley end well. Sugars balance it nicely. Lots of vanilla a bit of the swiss miss cocoa concept. Mouth is full and coats the tongue the way a sweet stout should. Bottle

From a bottle. Pour opaque dark brown with a fizzy tan head. Tastes like dark chocolate malt, booze, smokey wood, ashy, and earth. Light/medium body and carbonation. Smells like dark chocolate malt, earthy, ashy wood, and booze.
Bottle 33cl @cervezorama, madrid. Dark color, strong flavour, not very dense. Good.

It¬ís been a little while since I¬íve started a review with a blatantly inappropriate comment. Here¬ís one for not-so-old time¬ís sake: Bell¬ís Double Cream Stout was so good it made me cream myself twice. Okay, I¬íve got that out of my system. This Sweet Stout pours black and opaque. Cocoa and coffee smells. Bold roasted coffee flavor with some (but not too much) lactose behind it. Some chocolate and a little licorice. Smooth as suede. It was a damn good breakfast pairing.

Not up to Bell¬ís standard, an aroma of malt and coffee with a hint of smoke, pours a dark brown color with a lasting tan foamy head. A dry feel with a bitter coffee taste and dry bitter chocolate finish.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Special Double Cream Stout by Bell¬ís Brewery at Hostal Plaza De GoyaZ 12/01/15. Niewiele ciala, ale poza tym bardzo fajny, slodkawy, owocowy, nieco palony, pumperniklowy. Troche jak dobry baltycki. Bdb+Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Tasting session @ Budapest. Aromas of nutty, roasted malts, roasted chocolate, lactose, vanilla, nougat. Taste is chocolate sweetness with caramel and nutty notes. Mouthfeel is a bit too light bodied with moderate carbonation.

On tap at Oblivion. Creamy light roasted barley aroma with a little vanilla and walnuts. Opaque black under a tan patch and collar. As named, super creamy stout, with oatmeal, licorice, toasted hazelnut, and vanilla accents. Medium light body, moderate to low carbonation, smooth.
UPDATED: SEP 4, 2016 Bright smell, Smooth draft, dark color, rich taste followed by a soft easy long losing taste. Little Smokey hop near the middle/end of the first sip.
Bottle from mikkeller. Pours Black with a beige head. Aroma of choko, roast, light vanilla, milk choko. Rather bitter roast, quite sweet. Sweet finish with a bitter roast.

Bottle 35,5cl
@ LaBIRRAtotium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Black.
T: Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, vanilla.

(35 cl bottle from Mikkeller Bottleshop bought for 7¬Ä in May 2016; Packaged on: 12/01/15) Poured at fridge temperature into a Maisel&Friends stemmed tulip reveals a pitch black body with one finger of tan head that fades somewhat yet sticks around and leaves plenty of beautiful lace. Good regeneration. Aroma seems harmonic with well integrated notes of toasted malt and chocolate. Definitely creamy texture with soft carbonation, medium body and a roasted finish with a little drying ascerbicity toward the end. Generally it¬ís kept in check in the flavour by just the right amount of sweetness. Supremely well balanced and understated refinement in flavour and aroma.
Flaska fr√•n Mikkeller Webbshop. Smak och doft av karamell, kaffe, rostade malt, vanilj, br√§nt socker med toner av aska. Fadd, lagom s√∂tma, fin balans mellan smakerna. Gott!

It pours black with a brown moderate head. It has aromas of chocolate, expresso, and a bit of roast. There are flavors of chocolate, roast, oats and a bit of vanilla. It is somewhat creamy with a moderately bitter finish. It has a full body. Overall this is a chocolate and creamy driven stout.

12 ounces bottle (11.09.15) from Craft Beer Cabin, thanks Guillaume for buying. Aroma: chocolate, light smokiness and ashes, light caramel far behind. Pretty sure there are lots of hops in there. App: pitch black with small mocha head, great lacing. Taste and palate: medium body but texture feels thin, creamy, some chocolate in mouth, medium sweet and slightly rosted finish. Overall: milk stout? Feels a bit thin and creamy. It¬ís really easy to drink. I prefer my stouts more robust but I can enjoy stuff like this since it has a high drinkability level. Deserves this name.

Draft at cappy¬ís. Dark pour, clear with ruby highlights, khaki head, minimal lacing. Coffee, roast, medium- body, chalky texture, lightly sweet, medium bitter finish. Not as creamy as name suggests, comes off harsher than I imagined it would. Overall: okay, but not gonna seek this one out again.
D¬íampolla al BBF-Lab Barcelona 2016. Cervesa amb aromes torrats, de xocolata, cacau, i caf√®.Cos mig-baix i sed√≥s amb carbonataci√≥ baixa. Molt bona.
Bottle at home. Black - offwhite head. High malty. Sweetness. Ok burned. Ok sweetness. Cocoa. Chocolate. Smooth body. Some vanilla. Bitter burned. Some licorice. Nice.

Pours dark opaque coffee brown, creamy cappuccino head. Coffee and roasted malt aroma. Coffee and roasted malt flavor, nice slightly bitter/ashy finish to balance. Palate creamy. Overall, chewy, creamy, rich, while not overly sweet, with slightly dry finish.
Tap at Whole Foods, Omaha. Poured black, creamy tan lasting head. Aroma was chocolate, roasted coffee, nutty. Taste was sweet, creamy, coffee, chocolate. Very nice.
Bottle @ Mikkeller. Poured black with a creamy beige head. Coffee and chocolate. Some vanilla. Smooth and soft with a dry roasted finish.
Bottle in Seattle. Thanks Andrew. Tiny head, quick foam. Deep brown, lactic, deep milk chocolate, mocha. Rich, creamy, delicious, ok spicy alcohol. Tasty but not outstanding.
Nice roasted flavour with some oats. Pours black with thin tan head. Tastes really nice rich malt flavour with little bitterness or astringency. Interesting mouth coat, lots of flavour, good.
Black with quick fading head. Aroma and flavour have are intense but certainly not overpowering. Smooth and creamy texture. Flavours of sweet coffee with milk and some chocolatey notes too.

12 oz bottle poured. Pours a near black with a loose bubble head. Aroma is initially sweet, with a caramel malt and chocolate settle. Flavor is rich chocolate, some vanilla, but masked by a roasted finish. A little empty on the finish. Some late chocolate, cocoa reminder. Pretty good, but expectations were not quite met.
Bottle shared at tasting. Dark black pour, almost no head. Sweet malty aroma. Taste is a little thin but nice flavors. Very good.

Bell¬ís Special Double Cream Stout has a thick, beige head, a dark, red-brown appearance, and almost no lacing left behind. The aroma is of sweet, brown bread, a touch of coffee and chocolate, and a shade of cream. Taste is of those elements, with noticeable, but low-level, bitterness, really, some acrid notes, and char. Mouthfeel is low medium, and Bell¬ís Special Double Cream Stout finishes on the slightly dry side. RJT

Botella. Color marr√≥n muy oscuro casi negro corona compacta y persistente. Carbonatacion media. Aroma a az√∫car quemado, licor, caf√© y melaza. En boca entra dulce dando paso a notas de caf√© y melaza acabando m√°s bien dulce y licorosa. Alcohol perfectamente integrado con sabor y cuerpo
Dark pour with roasting aromas of dark chocolate, tobacco, and dark roast coffee; big mouthfeel and palate with malt forward presence and a nice prolonged finish. Tastes bigger than its 6%

Flaska fr√•n Mikkeller Webbshop. En lite l√§ttare godisstout med vissa likheter med Expedition. S√∂t karamell, vanilj, br√§nd socker, cr√©me karamell samtidigt som att rostningen √§r ganska k√§rv. Trevlig och v√§lbalanserad och st√∂rre √§n sina 6,1%. Riktigt trevlig.
Negro con reflejos caoba y espuma de beis. Aromas de chocolate, caf√©, licor, fruto negro. Cuerpo medio, con sabor de fruto negro, chocolate y final de amargor acafetado.
Dark brown body with a small tan head. Aromas of chocolate/coffee/smoke. Flavor is a little bitter with the taste of chocolate and roasted malts.

Una Stout que se deja beber muy bien gracias a sus 6,2 grados.
Espuma cremosa marronosa, que se puede comer con cuchara!

Olor penetrante a caf√© y tabaco. Con final seco 

Densidad baja que sumada a sus 6 grados hacer que sea bebible y...¬ørefrescante?

Recuerda a una negra Munich con todo lo que ha de tener una stout ...

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 Bottle at home. Pours an opaque black with a small beige head and lacings. Sweet with a mellow bitterness. Aromas of toffee with toasted malts towards the end. Medium bodied. Medium to soft carbonation. Bitter finish with tiny hints of chalk. Well balanced.

Bottle pour..light black color..minimal head as expected..nose is roasted malts with toasted almond nutty presence..mouthfeel is good with lactose cream and some undertones of milk-dark chocolate..leaves some stout aftertaste that would be expected from a bigger abv offering, not a giant fan of the style but this is decent overall, more nutty roastiness than anything else..
Bottle from Biercab shop. Black colour with small brown head. Chocolate, malt aroma. Sweet, chocolate, caramel, malt taste, slightly roasted. Medium to full body.
pour black without a head. light nutty, and roasty aromas, taste light bitter notes, soft sweetness. medium bodied, average carbonation. light dry finish

330ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Muddy brown color. Small size, tan head, stays as a thin layer. Dark milk chocolate, fruity, grainy, sweet in aroma. Roast, milk chocolate, spicy hops in taste. Spicy hops, roast and chocolate in aftertaste. Soft carbonation. Pleasant in mouth. Very well done brew.

(355ml bottle shared @ VilleValla Pub, Link√∂ping, April 21 2016) Pours black with a moderate pale tan head and lace. Aroma of milk chocolate, toffee, stewed fruit, a bit of cake. Flavour is creamy milk chocolate, dark caramel, some toasted grains, light chocolate hints, gingerbread. Fairly sweet to start, slightly drier in the finish. Moderate toast. Low flavour concentration. Smooth and kind of soft on the palate, but still medium bodied. Soft carbonation. Nice enough, but I found it a bit too laid back and just a little too sweet for its body.

Pours dark with low tanned head 
Aromas of milk chocolate, nougats, caramel 
Taste has notes of milk chocolate, burned caramel, brown sugar, , dark fruits

330ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut
Rather nice porter roast aroma, some graininess. Lovely roasty taste, some mellow coffee aspect, pleasant huskiness. Super drinkable palate - full, but not heavy. Lovely dry bitter hops in the finish. The US is still absolutely nailing the porters. But this isn¬ít sweet, it¬ís really well attenuated, just how I like it.

Bottle shared by Mart. Brown beer, smallish tan head. Nose is mild roast and milk chocolate, some coffee. Flavor is sweet milk chocolate, ash, roast. Ashy finish, more roast and chocolate. Lingering roasty acidity.

Bottle (from mikkeller webshop). Pours dark brown. Aroma is roast, coffee, dark chocolate, slightly oaty. Flavor is sweet and bitter, coffee, roast, oats, malt, lactose. Body is rather light. Overall: very nice.
Nice dark chocolate and roasted malt aromas. Taste is sweet dark chocolate, roasted malts, and then cream, roasted malts, and dark chocolate in the finish.

April 20, 2016. Bottle, bottled January 27, 2016. 
Black with a large creamy tan head, Aroma is roasted malt, some caramel,roasted ground coffee, salty licorice, coffee, toffee, dark chocolate, hints of ink, vanilla and ash. Taste is light sweet, soft medium roasted bitterness. Finish is light sweet with some toffee notes and hints of vanilla, dry roasted bitterness with cocoa, roasted coffee, some ash notes with a very light earthy note, some salty hard licorice notes.
Medium bodied, slightly creamy texture, soft, small bubble carbonation. 
Nice, has that finishing sweetness the Kalamazoo stout was lacking and a bit creamier mouthfeel.

Pours a very dark brown with a low tan head. Aromas of nutty, roasted malts, roasted chocolate, lactose, vanilla, nougat. Taste is chocolate sweetness with caramel and nutty notes. Mouthfeel is a bit too light bodied with moderate carbonation.

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of milk chocolate, vanilla, almonds, nougat. Taste is mild chocolate bitter with a smooth mellow sweet finish. Body is a tad too light but smooth with soft carbonation.

Bottled. Pours deep brown with an average tan head. Aroma slightly roasted malt, chocolate and coffee notes. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and with bitter notes. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Stout. üåüüåüüåüüåü

This beer was available on draft on mad for mex which tends to ruin beers so perhaps it could be better. Very smooth stout with decent roastiness. Actually some aroma which is a welcome addition. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer&Beyond shop. Pours brown black with a small beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, caramel. Sweet malt, cocoa, coffee, nuts, chocolate flavors, light green notes, mild roasted acidity. Medium-bodied, almost dry finish.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer and Beyond, Tel Aviv. Opaque black with brownish head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, cream and hint of horse manure. Bittersweet flavor with notes of roasted malt, lots of coffee, a bit creamy. Medium-bodied, silky texture. Very good.

6.2%, great milk stout. Coffee flavor with more carbonation than I expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft to taster at cappy¬ís pour opaque black with thin tan head. Nose roasted malt, chocolate, sweet oats. Taste sweet from the beginning, red fruit, then moderate roasted malt. Milk chocolate and coffee mid palate.

Medium/light aroma with hazelnut, dark chocolate and a hint of slightly roasted malts. Pitch black color with small/medium light beige head. Medium, organic, averagely balanced taste with nice combination of dark chocolate and roasted malts. A hint of dark fruits like plum. Medium taste spectrum and medium aftertaste with mildly roasted malts. Medium body with light/medium carbonation. Overall, balanced and organic stout without needless trickery.

Pours a deep dark brown with a medium tan head. Aroma is dark chocolate, roasted hazelnuts, and coffee creamer. Flavor is rich chocolate, a little on the sweet side. Sweet creamy finish. Smooth, slick mouth feel. Full body. Good stuff.
wrote a pretty decent review and then had to sign in again so the review is lost. check the palate on this one it is really fine.

Draught @ Milk & Hops - Chelsea. Opaque dark brown with very small frothy beige head that was gone immediately, faint fruity aroma, medium carbonation, mocha, sour cherry taste, not too sweet, thin body, medium mocha finish. Very good, through not as sweet as I expected.

Bottle into stout glass. Black who'd head. Chocolate cream aroma. Similar taste and creamy mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: chocolate, caramel, 
Appearance: black with a tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious

Dark brown pour with a minimal head. Aromas of chocolate and coffee. Tastes like a milk stout, but it is completely dairy-free; cocoa and espresso and roasted malts. As advertised it has a smooth, creamy texture. Not terribly impressed with this one.
Black with a thin tan head. Aroma is cocoa and a little roast coffee. Flavor is bitter coffee with a mildly sweet cocoa finish. Very nice.

Type: 12-oz. bottle
Glass: Clear 14.75-oz. porter/stout glass
From: Bine & Vine Bottle Shop in Normal Heights (San Diego), Calif.
Price: $2.69
Purchased: Jan. 13, 2016
Consumed: Jan. 16, 2016
Misc.: Packaged on Nov. 10, 2015

Really looking forward to this one. I like Bells and I like stouts. I think their six-packs are a bit overpriced out here, but I like the idea of just getting a chance to try it. Prediction is between a 3.90 and 4.00 range.

Poured a black color with 2-to-3 fingers of frothy, tan head. Below average, spotty, wet lacing. Below average retention. (Sight - 3.50)

Smelled a pleasant whiff of chocolate, cocoa, chocolate malt, roasty malts, some coffee malts, Whoppers candy and chocolate milk. Very nice. (Smell - 4.50)

Taste followed the nose nicely, although not quite as good. Got fresh chocolate brownies, sugary chocolate malt, smoky fire, char wood, bitter roasted coffee malts, dark chocolate, chocolate milk shake, milky cream and Cinnabon. (Taste - 4.00)

Full body. Creamy-to-chewy texture. Average carbonation. Long finish. (Feel - 4.00)

Really liked this beer, especially for the style. Definitely some artificial stuff in there, but it works. Special Double Cream Stout is perfect for the name. (Overall - 4.00)

4.09 91 A-
Bottle. Pours black with thin tan head. Aroma is Sweet Chocolate Malt. Taste is sweet malty chocolate with a sweet chocolate finish. I really like it.

(Bottle) Black body with a medium to large, dense brown head. Molasses aroma; earthy, milk chocolate, sweet caramel; bitter roasted notes. Flavor of dark chocolate, bitter and dark roasted; moderately sweet with a dry finish; hint of coffee. Full bodied, soft mouthfeel.

Bottle. Black with a mocha head. Rich, creamy, soft, roasty, smoke, espresso notes, chocolate. Excellent. Perfect balance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 oz bottle. Dark brown with ruby highlights. Thick tan head, sticky lace. Aroma is coffee, lactose, chocolate. Flavor is bitter roast coffee, followed by sweet milk sugar.
Bottle from K&L in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, some coffee in there. Taste is smooth, chocolately with mild vanilla creaminess. Has a milk stout quality that I don¬ít love.

Draft at Frisco ... Black with thin white head. Strong roasted coffee and chocolate presence on the nose and palate... Smooth toffee and cream finish... Yum!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown with an amber hue. Small khaki head that quickly dissipates leaving a small ring on the edge of the glass. AROMA: rich dark malt, chocolate, roasty, nuts, herbs, chipotle peppers, coffee, earthy, smoke,  molasses and herbal hops. TASTE: rich dark malt, chocolate, roasty, nuts, herbs, chipotle peppers, coffee, creamy, faint soy sauce, spices, earthy, smoke,  molasses and herbal hops. AFTER TASTE: chile pepper, malty, coffee, spices and smoke with a creamy spiced finish. Bottle: 09/18/2014

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2015 Nice bold stout flavor though not what I expected as far as fluidity. I don¬ít think Bell can do any better than they did with Expedition and it¬ís going to be difficult for me to rate one any higher than I did that one.

black, tan cap. Aroma is some chocolate, roast, kinda nutty, tad sweet. Taste is smooth chocolate, roast, mild acidity but more in finish. Some dryness in finish. Soft overall.Slick up front texture from lactose?
Earthy, espresso bean, brownie, roasted chestnut, hint of dark fruit mid palate.

On tap at The Feed in Chattanooga. Pours black with a thick caramel head. Aroma is of burnt malt but very minimal. Taste is heavy on dark chocolate and roasted coffee. Oily in the mouth with a bitter backend. I prefer the Kalamazoo stout to this.

12oz bottle to glass. Traverse city. 

Pours dark brown with tan generous head. Nice lacing. Really pretty beer. 

Aroma is cocoa, roasted grains, coffee. 

Taste mildly sweet with a touch of bitterness. 

Light airy body. Frothy, silky texture. Clean coffee finish. Great mouthfeel. 

It¬ís with trying this beer for the mouthfeel alone. Not overly strong, but really really nice. 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Flying Squirrel in Chattanooga. Aroma of roasted coffee, some chocolate, smokey. Didn't smell the milky aspect. Taste seems to have a smokiness to it. I expected more cream and sweetness. Actually bitter. Ok...so I got a taste of Kalamazoo alongside, and now it's more thick, creamy. Just as a random thought, but it's amazing what they produce with the Black Note. The thick creaminess of this beer blends well with Expedition. If it's just for the purpose of Black Note, which is a top three stout for me, then this beer did it's job!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 355ml.
Pours black/ very dark brown with low beige head. Aroma is of coffee, roasted malt. Taste is of chocolate, roasted malt, coffee. Palate: Full bodied. Soft carbonation. Overall: Very nice. Excellent chocolate.
Opaque black-brown, light tan head. Latte, earthy dark fruit notes. Light bitterness, big sweet body. Very chewy, clean, medium long finish. Heavy body. Good.

Bottle. Pours a deep brown with a medium khaki head. Decent lacing. Dark chocolate, roasted hazelnuts, and creamer on the nose. Similar flavor - chocolate is a little sweeter in the flavor than on the nose. Sweet cream finish. Very smooth, slick mouthfeel, fairly heavy. Good stuff.

Creamy with a small smoky taste.  Not much more to it.  Little or no after taste at all.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bell's brewery did a good job with this stout. Taste of cream initially but quickly disappears in the background. Would drink again 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The best stout I¬íve had. I found it at a little restaurant in WI on tap and I can¬ít get it out of my head. Beautiful balance of chocolate and coffee in the background behind a rich, silky texture.

Bottle courtesy of tkrjukoff. Pours blackish brown with a rather small pale mocha head that leaves some sparse spotty trace in the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, salty liquorice candy, moist soil and leather. Taste is tiny sweet, bitter and malty. Mouthfeel is soft, velvety, round, tiny roasted astringent and medium to full bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with roasted malts, crisp bread, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, sweet liquorice candy and moist soil. Huge malt bill in a smooth tasty stout. Yum!

Smells like cream, milk, and stout. Medium carbonation that is kind of sharp actually. Incredibly smooth. Almost unbelievably so. I thought the Kalamazoo Stout was smooth, but man, this is the definition of smooth. If other stouts are dark chocolate, this is the sweet milk chocolate with a side of milk and cookies. A mild stout with a very milky, creamy taste. Aftertaste is medium-long length and the same. Doesn¬ít really end with a noticable slightly bitter coffee/dark chocolate finish that a lot of stouts end with. It¬ís mostly just a fading of the creamy mild stout taste.
Smell and taste with roasted coffee, malt, semi sweet dark chocolate, color in clear dark blown with thin crown, slightly slimy texture, very smooth creamy finish...just wish it last a bit longer
Old rating. Stellar stout. Creamy as advertised. Dark brown. Bittersweet chocolate, coffee, milk chocolate. Long bitter finish, nice.

Bottled 10/16/14. Pours black, with tan creamy head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, sweet lactose notes. Flavor is roasted, chocolate malt, sweet, but not overly so. Little to no bitterness. Very nice.

The aroma of chocolate and light coffee. The taste is bitter and mostly coffee. Light bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth for a long while. Not as creamy as I had anticipated me. But okay. Follow me @ Kung av √∂l @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle, great beer. Pours dark brown with thin tan head. Hints of chocolate. coffee, toasted malts, both on the nose and pallet. Creamy smooth finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Clear dark brown/mahogany with thin tan head. Aroma of malt sweetness, molasses, roasted malt, and dark chocolate. Medium body, roasted malt astringency upfront, light coffee, medium sweetness, and a dry roasted finish. Aroma was better than the flavor, but still a nice stout.
Pours black with a light beige head. Aroma of malt. Flavor is sweet malt and chocolate.

Bottle at Taska Gau, Ponce, PR. Dark, almost opaque color, tiny beige head. Coffeish, bready aroma. Medium-bodied. Light coffee, even light tart note. Lingering dark chocolate. Not in Bell¬ís standards.

Pours black. Stable fluffy white head. Smell is roasted malts, some coffee an oaty side. Taste is mild, creamy roasted malts. Very nice mouthfeel. Intensity is ok, good as it is yet i do prefer bigger intensity. Thick ( creamy) mouthfeel. Very easy drinkable ( than again, ot is not high abv. Though about 8 ish given the intense taste and mouthfeel) . Slightly sweet roastyness, even some chocolate hints next to the coffee and oats in the aftettaste nice one

Pours almost black with little or no head. Very nice aroma, slightly sweet. Taste is smooth but flat and somewhat dry. No harshness or bitterness. Flavor is lacking something. Not bad but not great. It was not unpleasant but I probably wouldn¬ít buy it again. The flavor just isn¬ít bold enough and a little too dry for my liking.

Creamy, sweet and smooth with a pleasant aftertaste. Great with chocolate flavors.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at Ginger Man, New York. Colour is black with small creamy white head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. Very soft but could be heavier.
Im not a big stout fan but it was OK than i added a shot of bourbon and was alot easier for as i am huge barrel aged guy

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2016 2016 re-rate: Chocolate milkshake nose, light cacao aromas. Creamy on the palate, touch of roast. Light bodied. Sweet and bitter finish. Solid. 12oz bottle bought at J¬ís Liquor in Owensboro, KY. Poured into a stemmed tulip. Beautiful deep black color with reddish glow. Soapy, medium-sized caramel-colored head. Nice aromas of chocolate and sorghum with a hint of coffee. Super smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Taste is very malty like an old-school milkshake.

Creamy texture with smooth foamy bubbles. Somewhat average stout flavor -- brown sugar, acidic coffee, chocolate -- but smoother around the edges. The cream/lactose isn¬ít as prevalent as I was expecting, but it adds a touch of sweetness. Unique for its softness and drinkability. Very approachable.

Nitro tap at shamrock! Its like a chocolate milkshake! Black pour with cascading tan head. Milk Chocolate and light roast. Smooth creamy taste. Milk chocolate smooth. Crazy drinkable. The nitro just adds so much.

Bottle from Bell¬ís General Store in Kalamazoo. Pour is deep red-black with a thin, short-lived tan head. Aroma is barely present, hint of roasted malts. Taste is thick, creamy, with more roasted malts, and just a touch of bitterness in the finish. Another excellent stout from Bell¬ís.

Dark mahogany, tan head that dissipates quickly. Roasted coffee notes to start, then vanilla. I was expecting more sweetness in a cream stout than is evident here. Not off-putting, but tastes more like a typical dry stout to me.

Also a tad too much carbonation for style, in my opinion. Good body. Overall it¬ís decent brew, but only average.

I had this next to 3 Floyd¬ís Molokolo Stout and Bell¬ís killed that one! Rich, creamy, notes of bitter chocolate and coffee, a slight bit of sweetness. Two thumbs up. Don¬ít buy into the 3 Floyd¬ís mind game!
Very dark brown with brown head. Roast coffee aroma. Ultra-creamy mouth-feel, sweet cream and dark chocolate. Finish has dark cocoa bitterness. Delicious.
12oz bottle pours a black color without much head. Smooth stout with lots of roasted malt flavor.
On tap @ Sharkey¬ís Radford. Pours mahogany, good head that doesn¬ít hang around. Smell is dark malt and chocolate, taste is rich but with a reasonably dry finish. Very smooth, really nice.
pour is black with nice creamy head...very light lacing....nose is very light licorice and smoke....mouth is same yet smooth...slight bitter finish...decent.

On tap at Barcade Philly.
Appearance: Pitch black body, creamy tan head.
Aroma: Very light aroma highlighting the lactose. Reminds me a bit of chocolate milk.
Taste: Mellow flavor as well, light chocolate milk presence.
Palate: Medium bodied, moderately carbonated.
Overall: Nice to drink, doesn¬ít impress, but I¬íd order it again.

12oz bottle, pours black with tan head. Smallish head. Aroma is chocolate, caramel, slight hop. Taste is typical stout, cream, vanilla slightly, chocolate. Medium body, low-moderate carbonation, creamy mouthfeel with chocolate roast finish. A typically good Bell¬ís beer.
Stout. Slight licorice aroma. Black but not black as night. Soft flavor, coffee. Great carbonation.
Poured very dark with no head. Sweet caramel aroma. Lightly carbonated. Moderately sweet flavour. Slightly bitter finish. Not bad.
Packing plenty in for a 6% beer. Sweet chocolate cake, wood and some bitter coffee notes to finish. All in good balance and indeed elegance.
Malty smell, very dark and heavy taste, heavy coffee without the bitterness, and smooth! Quite Good!

Bottle into oversized snifter glass, opaque deep dark brown color with tan lacing. Aroma of milk chocolate, roasted malt, light nuttiness, faint coffee and some earthy hops. Taste adds notes of cream, grain, dark chocolate and coffee grounds. Medium body, low-moderate carbonation, creamy with chocolate roast finish. Very well done sweet stout.

12 oz bottle. Appearance is dark brown color with little to no creamy, beige head. Aroma is cocoa and molasses. Taste is chocolate, roasted malts, sweet licorice, and slight pine. Palate is heavy, smooth, creamy texture, and sweet finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a black colour with a fluffy tan head that left beautiful thin lacing. Aroma is of dark roasted and chocolate malts with a hint of coffee. Flavor of grainy dark malts, slight cream, and coffee. Medium bodied with light carbonation with a smooth mouthfeel.

Bottle; 33cl; bought from CAMRA Beer Festival 2014. The big one. 

The colour of the head is beige and the beer is black and opaque. The aroma is grains; tar; cream; bourbon El Salvador coffee; toasted aroma from the malt; oak and leather. 

Taste is leather; blackcurrant; chocolate; Devon clotted cream; licorish; leather; tar; sticky toffee pudding; gains; raisin and burnt toast. Some smokey elements but not overbearing. Drinkability is good and I love the hoppy finish. Another well-made stout by Bell¬ís. Great take on the British style. Cheers guys.

Bottle dated October 30, 2014. Dark brown with a thin ring of a head. Chocolate malt nose, slightly roasty with mild cream / milk. Light aroma hops are earthy and woody. Medium body, semi-sweet, viscous and chewy, thankfully not overly milky or lactic, though the cream character is more like artificial coffee creamer rather than pure cream. Roundness and heft similar to the character given by oatmeal. Carbonic and minerally. Creamier body than Kalamazoo Stout, malt is cleaner and flavor balance more enjoyable.

12oz bottle shared by Pizz5116 after work (Christmas Squad beers round 2). Poured black with a small creamy tan head. Aroma and taste mimic each other. Roasted malts, dark chocolate, roasted coffee, and caramel. Smooth creamy mouthfeel. Solid

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2016 On tap, poured into a snifter. The aroma is pretty much the same as you¬íd get from freshly baked brownies. There¬ís a touch of a licorice aroma late, but still pretty much brownies throughout. It¬ís a dark, nearly opaque mahogany brown color, with a light, tan soapy head and a medium thick, big soap bubble ring. A dense, sheet-like lace is left behind on the glass. The taste is a medium high sweet and medium bitter. Much as the name would imply, this beer is creamy with a silky/creamy carbonation and a medium-full body that brings to mind German Chocolate Cake. Smokey notes with cola and licorice join the chocolate at the finish with a zesty spicy swell. It¬ís surprisingly dry for a creamy stout, with a slightly astringent, burnt cookie / brownie and cola aftertaste.

Bottle shared at Chriso¬ís post GBBF minidig, 16/08/14. Huge thanks to whomever brought this. clear ruby red amber coloured pour with a halo of cream head. Aroma is dark choc, light soy sauce, powdered choc, nutty. Nice milky, nutty, nutella, praline. Palate is low carbonation, milky, a bit dull. Lingering dark choc and light roast.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown/black with an off white head and lace. Aroma is lightly milky chocolate, with light coffee, light booze and a little rum. Light to medium body, medium carbonation. Milk chocolate, light coffee cake, touch of rum, a little liquorice.. Great stout
Pours black. Aroma is cream. Pretty light body, roasty with alot of cream taste and some chocolate. Slick oily texture. Really good and easy to drink

355ml bottle from New Beer Distributors, New York

Pours pitch black with a smooth white head. Aroma of roasty malts, chocolate and cocoa. Taste is smooth, sweetish and creamy with some coffee, cocoa and white chocolate notes. Finish is smooth, creamy and sweetish with some roastiness, cocoa and vanilla. Okay.
Pours black with a small head. Chocolate, char, malt aroma. Char, chocolate, black liquorice taste. Good beet

thick yellowish head leaves lacing. coffee coloured. aroma is yeasty, peppery, cocoa, roasted malts. taste like aroma, liquorice, bitter chocolate aftertaste. dry mouthfeel, rather thin body, lots of carbonation. bottle 35.5cl / bd sep-2014

Pours a dark brown with a thin off white head that dissipates quickly leaving little lacing. Very mild aroma with notes of vanilla and malt. Thinner mouthfeel than I expected. Coffee and chocolate notes with a toasty aftertaste. Not bad, but thin for a cream stout.

Bottle. Dark brown, almost black, with medium tan head. Aroma is dark chocolate, coffee, and roasted malts. Medium body and carbonation and creamy texture. Taste is sweet with hints of dark chocolate, coffee, and smoke. Slightly bitter aftertaste. This is a wonderful stout.

Bottle from Maltitude. Pours brown-black with brown head. Aroma of chocolate and roast, with a hint of hops. Taste of dark chocolate, with flavors of roasted malts and a bitter finish. Very very good.

Tap at Pizza Luce. Deep brown with a light brown head. Roasted malts, smokiness, milk chocolate, and clay. Taste has a chocolate milk sweetness with a ashy dryness. Body is heavier with a creamy feel.

Pours dark brown with a tan head. Roasted malt aroma with sweet caramel malt and cocoa. Creamy mouth feel. Sweet roasted malt start with vanilla and cocoa notes and coffee. Finishes with a sweet smooth roastiness.

12 oz. bottle from Cash Wise in Minot. Appearance: finger dark brown head, dark brown-black color, opaque, good lacing. Aroma: heavy chocolate and roast, notes of grassy hops. Palate: full body, soft carbonation, creamy into oily texture, silky. Taste: sweet chocolate, with a growing dark chocolate bitter and a light roast. Overall, amazingly smooth, one of the smoothest stouts I have had I think. The sweetness is great without being outshone by the balancing bitterness on the finish.

Draft @ North High CMH. Light roast aroma. Dark black color with reddish tint around edges. Tastes a little sweet, with nice roast flavor & appropriate bitterness. Appropriate medium body. Very drinkable, nice stout.
Excellent beer. Very dark almost reddish at the tip. tan head. One Of My FAVORITE BREWERIES. Tastes a bit lit milk stoudt and more sugar and malt. Amazing.

Very very smooth and creamy. Chocolate aftertaste. Thin in the body. Very subtle porter like qualities in this gem of a stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From the bottle...creamy with a coffee aftertaste....good but not great...it reminded me of Christmas

12 oz bottle. Bottled on 09/08/14. (Grape & Gourmet) Virginia Beach, 
VA
Pitch black pour with a small tan head. 
Roasted malt, dark chocolate, mild hops and some cookie sweetness in the aroma. The flavour is roasted malt, mild chocolate, some sweetness and mild hops. Quite nice. A bit thin.

Nice and smooth. Very drinkable and has a great earthiness to it. Lightly smoked tasting. Tastes almost like a porter that is as smooth as a milk stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pour dark brown with a tan head. Taste and aroma of chocolate, malt, coffee and tobacco. Nice smooth stout.

4 oz draft pour at B Side into a snifter. Black with tan head. Aromas of big roasty notes and chocolates. Tastes of roasty notes, caramel, vanilla, creamy notes, chocolate. Medium body with a dry finish. Creamy mouthfeel, medium-low carbonation. Delicious.
Bottle. Very dark brown almost black. Aroma was coffee, chocolate. Taste was burnt toast, coffee, chocolate, roasted grains. Not as sweet as one would imagine.
Sweet and smooth with mellow finish. Pours jet black with one finger he¬íd. Very smooth mouth feel

12 oz undated bottle poured into pint glass (from Jan. 2011 notes). 

A - Opague black/brown with dark mahogany highlights. Smallish tan head that too quickly turns to a small ring. Limited lacing.

Aroma of roasted malt with undercurrents of vanilla, coffee, chocolate. 

T- mainly dark roasted malt, with hints of coffee, chocolate and vanilla, in diminishing order. This stout has a definite sweetness to begin, but ends with a long but mellow bitter and slightly dry finish. Rich and interesting flavor. 

Mouthfeel is soft, smooth and creamy. Decent carbonation. Medium body. Seemed smoother as it warmed.

Another good beer from a great brewery.
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is roast, chocolate, raisins, and hint of vanilla. Flavor is roasted raisins with a sweet bitter finish. Flavor is rich and it stays with you through the finish.

Dirty dark brown, shade of light tan head. Nose is shoelaces and tobacco. Soft choc then a tight but thin bitter thread. Light milkiness but a tinny bitterness glazes over, a bit more of a spongey dark malt chaser than I¬íd been expecting. Finishes light nutty but is a long way off what I¬íd been hoping. Doesn¬ít overpower and passes quickly. Bottle from the Garvie USA haul, Beers Of My Youth Tasting

bottle at home ... deep black .. thin tan lacing ... soft chocolate ... dark chocolate ... soft malts ... soft roast... dark malts ... bit thin ... soft sweet malts ... light tobacco ... soft thin roast ... nothing exciting.
Bottle at Craig¬ís. Pours dark brown with a thin beige head. Aromas of coffee, light chocolate. Taste is more of the same, something pruney. Thin body.
Bottle. Black with tan head. Roasty aroma with chocolate and coffee. Taste of coffee, chocolate, toffee. A little thin and bitter.
Bottle at Craig¬ís. Pours black, nose is roasty coffee, sweet chocolate, taste is dry roasted, sweet, thin.
Smooth black pour tan head. Chocolate cream aroma. Very smooth lots of chocolate and silky cream taste. Some coffee notes. Light to moderate body light carbonation perfect mouthfeel. Nice.

Bottle at home from GBBF. Clear dark brown pour with ruby highlights, medium beige head that sinks, leaving some lacing. Complex roast and chocolate aroma, toasted nuts. Sweet milky chocolate initially, followed by dry roast and more toasted nuts, touch of acidity, cocoa, some hop bitterness. Fairly full body, softish carbonation, creamy texture, long bitter chocolate and hop finish. Really solid stout this, great complexity for the ABV and great drinkability considering how big it feels. Do Bells brew bad beers?

Served on cask at Al¬ís of Hampden into a nonic pint.


A - Pours dark as night with a solid one finger, creamy, tan head that leaves thick lacing down the entire glass.


S - Strong sweet aroma right off the bat. Hints of dark roasted malts, espresso, chocolate, and cream. The sweetness overpowers nearly all of the smaller aroma¬ís in this one.


T - Quite sweet up front quickly giving way to a creamy mix of coffee, chocolate, and other rich earthy flavors. Finish is a strong roasted flavor that is a bit overpowering. A fairly well put together cream stout.


M - Heavy flavor and feel with moderate carbonation. Very smooth with rich, roasted, flavors clinging to the pallet long after consumption.


D - I am sure I could drink a few of these, just maybe not all in one sitting. A very nice cask offering from Bell¬ís.

Bottle from GBBF 2014 and drunk at home. Black beer lasting tan head. Creamy dark chocolate aroma, I mean a lot of chocolate it¬ís a bit like sniffing a bar of Bournville Cadburys chocolate to be honest but a bit creamier. More of the same in the mouth, but no heaviness, it¬ís quite light at heart. A little roastyness. It¬ís fine. Not really my thing, but at least no obvious lactose to put me off. Aroma is attractive. Everything else is good but just not my style of beer. Prefer something drier, hoppier, blonder and generally more like an ipa. But then that¬ís just me.

Transfer from BA review on 1-15-13-
S erved on tap in a pint glass

 Appearance ¬ñ The beer is served a nearly pitch black color with a fine, thin tan colored head. The head fades very fast to leave only a light level of lacing.

 Smell ¬ñ The aroma is on the sweeter side with a good presence of chocolate and a nice sweet lactose/milk aroma. Mixed with these smells are notes of a light coffee smell as well.

 Taste ¬ñ The taste begins with some flavors of a sweet milk chocolate and a roasted malt flavor. While upfront there is a good sweet milky presence, as the taste advances the sweet loses some of its ground and the flavor becomes more bitter and darker in nature. While this occurs, some lighter earthy hop flavors start coming to the tongue. These, in the end, when combined with the more roasted, lightly sweet, and darker chocolate flavors create a very nice roasty flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel ¬ñ The body of the beer is on the slightly thicker and chewier side with a carbonation level that is rather average. The thicker body was quite nice for the darker and roasted flavor of the brew and made it drink more like an 8-9 % abv brew as opposed to its 6.1 % abv nature.

 Overall ¬ñQuite a tasty brew. It¬ís a ¬ìnot too overly sweet¬î and fairly roasty cream stout. Well worth a try.

Sampled @ ChrisO after GBBF day 2. Very dark brown to black color, small brown head. Aroma is malts, roasted malts, chocolate. Taste malts, roasted malts, bitter, roasty bitterness, dark chocolate. Medium body and carbonation. Quite nice.

Bottle. Pours a dark reddy brown/black with an off white head. Aroma is lightly milky chocolate, with light coffee, light booze and a little sherry/rum. Light to medium body, medium carbonation. Milk chocolate, light treacle, grass, light coffee cake, touch of rum, a little liquorice... A touch on the thin side. Aside from that it¬ís well balanced and pretty tasty.

12 fl oz bottle. Pours hazy brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty and light caramelish. Bitter and toasted. Dark malty and dense chocolate malty. Bitter and toasted malty into a breadish and light herbal roasted dry finish.

Pours a dark brown to black color with a medium tan head that disapates quickly. Aroma is lite but has the chocolate and coffee notes that you look for in good stouts. A easy but flavorful beer to drink that has the perfect amount of bitterness for a every day drinker.
Pours black. Aroma is chocolate and sweet roasted malts. Taste is sweet, creamy, and follows the nose.

Dark black. Tan head. Pretty sweet at first but dries out. Complex malt build. Quite smooth. Like milky chocolate. I enjoyed this one. Thanks Seymour. This would be interesting with mint or strawberry.

Deep dark very nearly black beer with a big tawny colored head that lingers on for quite awhile. It appears to be well carbonated.
Aroma is that of sweet roasted malts also chocolate and coffee.
Definitily has a sweet roasted malt character to it. I get a nice complex roasted malt flavor upfront. then turns mellow and sweet.
A very nice mouth feel with a smooth soft mellowness and a dry finish.
Nice lacing from the sticky foam head.
I taste tasted this beer waiting for my kids to come home from school. It was a cool blustery day with clouds in the sky.
My flag was waving in the breeze in front of a brillant red maple turning quickly in the autumn sky.
That was a good beer.

Pours a deep near black brown with a dark tan head. Aroma of coffee roasted and smokey. Taste is sweet up front with a creamy mouthfeel that carries the beer from sweet to roasted with a clean finish and residual smokiness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz Bottle. Tasted on 6/27/14. Beer from Whole Foods Naples, FL. The beer has a sweet roasted scent to it. The taste is smooth & creamy with hints of coffee, cream & licorice. Overall a good cream stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUN 21, 2014 Chocolate notes, dried fruits and slight coffee on the nose.Heavy malts, some chocolate ....vanilla and sweet cherries.

Awesome black pour w/ a great tan head that leaves excellent lacing. The aroma is a little faint - w/ some chocolate notes. The taste is kind of plain w/ a touch of bitterness in the end. Light & drinkable - overall pretty solid!
Bottle. Pours nearly black with a beige head. Aroma is dark coffee and dried, dark fruits. Flavor is dark chocolate, licorice, dark coffee. Nice and smooth.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Pours black with a beige head, aroma is sticky and glue with chocolate, vanilla and wood, flavor of chocolate, vanilla, wood, sourness, medium bodied.

11 oz bottle. Pours a roasty dark black with lasting thin white head. Red wine hues when backlit. Aroma is lactose sweetness, chocolate notes, and sweet roasted malt. Flavor is same with sweet lactic milky mouthfeel. Balanced and solid.

12 oz bottle into a snifter. Pours a dark black with a small light tan head that fades quickly and leaves a bit of lacing. Aroma of cocoa, black licorice, coffee, and dark fruits (plum, raisin). Taste is cocoa and dark chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, and black licorice. Slightly dry finish of cocoa and bittersweet chocolate. Full body, thick texture, average carbonation. Excellent stout! Everything a good stout should be.

Look: pours a dark black. Slightly thinner than I anticipated. Light brown sugar head that disappears quickly.
Smell: heavy sweetness almost like candy. Red apples, chocolate, sweet cherries. Chocolate
Taste: heavy malt, but still sweet. Premium chocolate, a little coffee. Slight bitterness on the back
Feel: thin on the palate not heavy or oily at all. Not heavily carbonated
Overall: not a bad beer. Still looking for something sweeter.
Pours dark brown body very thin brownish head, good lacing. Aromas of toasted malt, coffee and chocolate and toffee. Taste is somewhat sweet with balanced bitterness.

Dark black pour foamy creamy head and nice lacing. Aroma is roasted malt. Smells and tastes like a typical micro stout or poster. Coffee notes bitter at first taste. Goes down pretty easy. Pretty one dimensional it is what it is. Bitter finish takes some getting used to.

Shared a bottle at the Alpha tasting room, thanks Derrick! It poured a clear dark reddish brown colour with thick, everlasting brown foam and lace. He demonstrated the inverted-bottle-pour-trick, which produced an amazing foamy appearance. A truly delicious Cream Stout: tart and toasty, CHOCOLATEY, strong coffee and tobacco notes too. SMOOTH, SMOOTH, SMOOTH. Medium-full body, well-rounded mouthfeel, low-medium carbonation, complex aftertaste. Highly recommended.

On tap at Jeffery's smooth with chocolate taste.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This one smells better than it tastes. The deceptively sweet and creamy smell causes the normal beer bitterness to be a bit of a surprise -- unpleasant if you were hoping for a sweet flavor, just odd if you were expecting something smoother.

Smells of black licorice, milk chocolate, coffee and malt. Basic looking stout; black with light tan head that disappears quickly. Tastes highly carbonated, smoky, roasty with slight hop bitterness. Hoppy and coffee flavored aftertaste. I thought it would be sweeter, like a milk stout. Palate was just ok. I must say this is kind of a weak stout, but I am biased by bigger, thicker, higher ABV stouts. Sacrilege, I know, but this is an average offering by Bells.
Great beer, dark chocolatey flavors mixed with some vanilla, and a roasty finish.
This beer is absolutely delicious-- creamy, sweet, with just the right amount of bitter. Perfect as a desert.
Pours a nice dark black, minimal head. Roasted malt and espresso on the nose, follows onto the palate with a little bit of cocoa. Delicious in the winter in the north.

Poured from cask at Fuel Woodfire Grill in Port Huron, MI. 

Pours a motor oil black with a limited amount of tiny bubbles. 

Not much on the nose. 

Insanely silky mouthfeel with only the smallest bit of carbonation. 

Tastes of bitter chocolate and tapers off with an alcohol finish. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours tobacco juice brown...dark. Pretty. Very little head and no lace to speak of. Toasted malts and espresso. Very nice saddle leather tack shop type taste on the palate. Bought April 15 with cold spell arriving. More carbonation than expected. Nice treat
Very dark brown body under a towering light brown head. Slightly slick mouth feel. Smooth going down.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown with tan head. Nose is chocolate and vanilla. Very smooth flavor. Excellent.

12oz bottle from Tasty Beverage in Raleigh. Black hue, zero visibility with fully diminishing dark brown head. No lacing. Dark chocolate, dark fruit, mild alcohol aromas. Moderate bitter coffee up front with a dark malt and coffee finish. Creamy texture on palate.

Poured from a bottle, deep black in color, thin tan disappearing head. Notes of espresso and vanilla bean on the nose. Hints of coffee, vanilla, toasted malts and oats, and dark chocolate.  Medium bodied very smooth mouth feel. Leaves the palate semi-dry. Super drinkable, always kept in rotation.
Bottle - big thick head, pitch black color, moderately roasty aroma and flavor, slight sweetness and creaminess, pretty good overall (and that coming from someone who is not the biggest stout fan)
Poured from 355mL bottle. Black with tan head. Aroma of roasted malt and chocolate. Taste same, neither overpowering, nice balance. Lightly creamy texture. Medium-full body.

Bottle. Pours walnut with a creamy mocha head; some splotchy lacing. Really enjoyed the aroma here - chocolate and roast highlighted by a sticky sweet vanilla. Taste is less complex - chocolate milk and roast. Medium body with a creamy mouthfeel. Very drinkable and tasty stout.

12 oz bottled 5 months ago, purchased at John¬ís Grocery ($2.49) and poured into a pint glass at home. Black appearance with a frothy, lingering light brown head, moderate lacing. Aroma of milk chocolate, vanilla, caramel, roasted malts and light coffee. Similar flavor, sweet and creamy with a light earthy bitterness. Medium body, smooth and softly carbonated with a rich, lasting finish.
Deep dark brown, near black with tan head. Aroma is espresao and vanilla. Can taste the roast malt, vanilla and coffee. Very nice beer for one of the last cold days od the year.

Very smooth and creamy milk stout with chocolate notes in the nose and taste.

Yummy, particularly on tap. Very creamy and light bodied. Espresso-y. Nice head.

355 mL bottle. The right colour, but not much head. Unsweetened cocoa powder and espresso in the nose. Not quite what I expected, but I¬ím not complaining. The flavour is more what I expected, with the srtong notes from the nose dialed back, but still present. There is some sweetness, but certainly not a lot. Creamy body. Thin at the end.

Dark in the glass, intense espresso in the nose. The beer starts dry, espresso-like, dark roasted. Intensive and still easy to drink. The mainpart is coffee, slightly sour, refreshing. In the aftertaste smoother, roasted-dry, slightly bitter.  Very nice stout. --> 12/12/12/12

A brown body with a brown head, nice retention and lace. It seemed to have a slight elevation of carbonation. Aroma had a strong roasted malt presence upfront, mild hints of cocoa balanced it out. Easy to drink, but it did have some body to it. Carbonation seemed high but was not a negative factor.

Draft at Khyber Pass. Black pour that faintly showed as clear ruby under bright light. Frothy tan head. Aroma is pretty blank (when cold at least) but the flavors are nice. Bells sure knows how to do stouts well. Thick, black, some tan head. A bit too cold on draft where I am enjoying it, but it is warming up some! Chocolate nose, smooth taste.

tasted as part of a Bell¬ís flight at Zillies. 12 oz bottle. Pours a clear dark black with light brown head, good lacing. Aroma is heavy malts, roast, chocolate, caramel. Taste is moderate sweet, light to moderate bitter. Body is medium to full. Texture is creamy.

12 ounce bottle into signature pint glass, bottled on 8/29/2013. Pours nearly pitch black color with a 1-2 finger dense tan head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass. Aromas of milk chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toast, toffee, light roast, cream, light vanilla, floral, and herbal/roasted earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt notes with some light hops; and good strength. Taste of milk chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toast, light roast, cream, light vanilla, dark bread, and floral/roasted earthiness. Minimal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of milk chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toast, cream, dark bread, and light roast on the finish for a good bit. Very nice balance and robustness of dark/roasted malt flavors; with no cloying sweetness after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a moderately creamy and smooth mouthfeel that is nice. Overall this is a very nice sweet stout. All around good balance and robustness of flavors; and very smooth to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

Wonderful nose. Lots of chocolate sweet malts and dark fruits. Toffee and caramel. Sweet malts all over the place. Wonderful beer.

12 ounce bottle. Opaque black color topped by a medium-sized tan head. Roasted malt aroma with hints of cocoa and charcoal. Smooth dark malt flavor with notes of coffee and dark raisins. Tasty and flavorful. Finishes dry and spicy.
Pours darker than the Alberta tar sands with nary a cap even after a hard pour. Sweet coffee, cocoa powder & burnt brown sugar on the tongue. Carbonation sizzles on the way down. A great stout.

Rich dark brown/black color; Medium to heavy creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, dark chocolate, & coffee; Flavor of roasted malt, hops, bittersweet chocolate, and coffee; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Good stuff.

Bottle. Black pour with a creamy head. Aroma of chocolate, fresh cream and coffee, but also a little musty - I found it somewhat off-putting. Flavour is heavy cream, coffee, vanilla notes and a touch of smoke. Taste is better than the smell. Overall, very pleasant - definitely a treat.
December 2009. From bottle. Very dark brown with a tan head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. Slightly sweet with a malty finish.

This beer pours a small tan with good retention, opaque body, spotty, and spotty amounts of lacing. The Aroma is malty, roasty, chocolate, coffee, and nutty. Ditto for the Taste along with a dry finish. The Palate is smooth and this is a medium bodied beer. In conclusion, this beer is most quaffable, definitely worth trying, and a beer I would drink again.
This beer pours dark with an almost non existent tan head. The nose does appear to have hints of cream however the overall taste is largely muted compared to comparable beers of this style

On draft at the new growler joint in Savannah. It pours darkest brown with a small tan head. The nose is light roast, toast, rich chocolate, caramel, sugary coffee and cake. The taste is smooth, mellow roast, earth, chocolate, caramel, cocoa powder, lactose and coffee with a bitter-sweet finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Not a whole lot if depth, but very tasty and drinkable.
Jet black pour with no head from 12oz bottle at home. Cream and coffee aroma. Thick oily pallet. Taste is deep chocolate cream coffee and rich. Great balance and almost perfect for this style
Bottle. Pours opaque dark brown with toffee colored head. Aroma of sugar and coffee. Tastes of roasted coffee and malt. Sweetens as it lingers.
Pours brown almost black with a creamy head. Smells of coffee, roasted malt and chocolate. Nice beer

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 09.06.2013, 0,35l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich, dark malts, salty licorice, soy sauce, coffee, chocolate, caramel. Taste is far from living up to the nice aroma, very boring, dark malts, hay, sour coffee, dark sugar, caramel, chocolate, hints of licorice. Little but longlasting bitterness. Quite disappointed with this one compared to the nice aroma.
pours a very dark brown, tons of creamy head... nose of a typical stout, nothing special.
Sweet on the nose, sweet on the taste. Good cream stout. Wish it was a little thicker.
Pours black with a thick light tan head. Aroma is sweeet espresso. Taste is smooth, sweet light coffee. The lactose makes itself known and the bitterness slides in for an easy finish.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2013 This beer smells like roasted malts and chocolate, and the appearance is an opaque black color with a medium tan head that fades to a thin layer on top of the liquid. The taste is complex with its mild umami, mildly sweetness, and the touch of bitterness, and the palate combines a soft carbonation, a medium body, a slick texture, and a long malty finish.

America Beer Classic. Pours a Dark brown almost black with a creamy head that dissipates to cap. A lot of lacing. Nose is booze, coffee, roasted malt and chocolate. Mouth is very roasty with a lot of booze. very creamy and chocolatey.

Inky black with a thick, mocha head. Roasted/burnt malt prominent on the nose and palate. Rich mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. This stout is a crash course on malt!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a black opaque color with off-white head. Aroma is of chocolate, roasted malt. Flavor is astringent with some roasted character. Mouthfeel is fizzy carbonation is average. Overlal this is an okay beer.

Black color, opaque, big buddy tan head.  Extra good, malty goodness, laces well, complex for a cream stout, this is no one-trick pony.  Roasty-toasty soft, great palate.  I really love this beer, it approaches perfection.

It pours a rich black color. It is one of the best smelling beers I have ever had. Rich chocolate cream, with a hint of malt. I was really excited. The taste is pleasant but boring. It starts off sweet and creamy which is great. Then it goes to lite bitter coffee finish. The taste is not that complex and goes quickly. One of the other beers I just had (chocolate oatmeal stout) was much more complex and had 5 different complex flavors and then had a similar bitter finish. Although that beer was much too bitter at the end.
Bottle, last single in the store. Definitely spicy, with a nice long aftertaste of spices. Definitely a warmer, creamy and tasty. Malty but not to complex.
36cl, American brew, thx to Secret Santa!, complex Stout, malty/roasted and slightly sweet/spicy, balanced, clear, good head, good Winter brew, yet expensive!

Roast and chocolate notes with a coffee backbone.  Black with a frothy tan head.  Slightly sweet coffee and chocolate flavors.  Smooth full bodied and a little thick and oily with a nice sweet finish.
Pours a dark brown with a tan lacing. Chocolate and coffee.  Heavy malt profile slightly metallic.
Smooth Stout. Similar to guinness but more of a bitter finish or maybe a bite of alcohol at the end.
Black pour.  Sweet aroma.  This is almost a sweet stout. Very light on the malt.  Not a whole lot of flavor going on but the smoothness and mouthfeel make up for it.
Bottle. Dark with tan head. Dark malty aroma. Creamy choco malt flavor. Slighty bitter.
Bottle pour - Nov. 2012 bottle date.  I like Kalamazoo better.  This is OK, but missing the sweetness and smoothness as claimed by the brewer.  Small amount of quickly dissipating head.

Poured into a Sam Adams "perfect pint" glass.

Appearance: Pitch black ... no light getting through this one. There¬ís about a two finger head that goes away pretty swiftly, but there¬ís some fantastic brown lacing.

Smell: Fantastic. Super sweet milk chocolate aromas, coffee, caramel, sweetness... make this beer a damn candle.

Taste/feel: Up front you get that extremely creamy texture which is awesome -- smooth all the way through. The taste is somewhat burnt, which turns me off a good bit, but the bitterness isn¬ít too extreme, and the super roasty malt flavors make it pretty drinkable. Overall, somewhat disappointed with this. The smell was promising, but the taste left a lot to be desired ... it¬ís just sort of bland. Still, it¬ís easy drinking.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2013 Poured from 12 oz. bottle. Opaque, near black with creamy 2-finger brown head and excellent lacing. Aroma of chocolate, grain, roasted malt, dark red fruit and coffee. Aroma is not strong, but it is otherwise very nice. Taste of smokey roasted malt, chocolate, dark roasted coffee, a little dark fruit and a toasted, bitter finish. Medium/light body and high/medium carbonation. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pour is a dark, almost black. Aroma is chocolate, malt, milk, and roaste. Taste is medium body with nice sweetness nice smooth mouthfeel.
12oz bottle, pours pitch black with a tan head.  Aroma is very coffee and chocolate forward.  Taste is sweet chocolate, roasted coffee, very smooth.  Fantastic stout.

Bottle to pint glass. Dark opaque appearance, light tan head. Sweet malty aroma. Smooth milk upfront, light roasted coffee aftertaste. Not a miss, but was looking for more robust flavor. Average overall

Deep walnut black. Large, lasting, creamy tan head with sticky lace. Just didnt pick up the aroma I thought I would. A little roasty but just not alot there for me. Lower side of medium in body, roasty and creamy.  Flavor of roasted malt, some lactose, sweetness, coffee. Tasty and extremely drinkable.
Slight hints of coffee on the back end... hits the palate just right. Smooth and creamy!

Tap at mellow mushroom Dublin. Black pour and thin brown thick head. Great milky mildly sweet nose. Great smooth mouthfeel. Malt, milk and coffee up front and coffee, chocolate and milk to follow. Pretty tasty and worth slapping your grandma over. 

---Rated via my mouth
Bottle - TWM Sterling - Entering old ratings from October and November 2012, reviews to come... Eventually.
Sample at Waldo Pizza.  Pours dark clear brown.  Aroma of cocoa, molasses, dried fruit. Flavor is creamy, milk, chocolate, vanilla.  Nicely done.

Bottle. Pours a stouty, opaque deep brownish-black, nice mocha head with good retention and lacing. Nose has some chocolate, roast, coffee the ususal suspects). Mouth is smooth and creamy (velvety is a good adjective), milk chocolate, slightly sweet, roasted barley, with whipped creaminess at the finish. Pairs well with Oreos (which is what I ate with them). Very nice!

This one a little bit of an underachiever. Aroma of some malt, lactose. Pretty low carbonation, average consistency. Pours dark mahogany with creamy head, some lacing. A little sour on aftertaste with some bitterness. Some dark chocolate in the aroma as well. Pretty well-integrated but nothing that jumps out at you. Bottle.

Outstanding cream stout.  Very nice, think body and head that stays for the whole glass.  Nice flavor, but prefer a more flavorful coffee stout.  Nice smooth finish.  No bitterness like you get in some imperial stouts.  Great winter beer I¬íll get year in year out.
Aroma: coffee, nuts, toast. Appearance: pitch black. Taste: very smooth stout. Didn¬ít quite live up to the hype, but nice on a winters night.
One of Bell¬ís all around best brews. Naturally it¬ís better on Draft but is easily one of the better stouts out there

The double cream pours nice and thick with a dark brown head that lasts a good while. The aroma is lacking but there are so many malty goodness flavors. A hint of chocolate and a hint of coffee but not a lot stands out. Very creamy and enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into an English pint glass.

Appearance: Poured black, but appears to be a very dark brown with a red tinge when held underneath a light. Poured hard for about 1 finger of tan head. Lacing is nice.

Aroma: I¬ím not getting a very strong scent, just a little malt, and a little coffee.

Taste: Nice and malty with a bit of semi-sweet chocolate, with a milk and coffee aftertaste.

Palate: Slightly thick, and very smooth, leaves the palate with a pleasant milky coating.

Malty sweet aroma. Pours deep brown black. Sweet taste with a crisp finish. A little thin in the mouth feel and a little too much carbonation. Still good. Bells never disappoints. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Thought this was pretty good.  Pitch black, with a roasty and choclatey aroma.  Flavor followed through to the taste with a nice bitter punch at the end.  Nice silky mouthfeel.
Bottle.  This is a super smooth stout that may be my favorite at this ABV level.  Grab a 6er when you see it.
12oz bottle pours dark brown almost appearing black. Strong coffee aroma. Roasted vanilla coffee and malt taste.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013 Had on tap at Waldo Pizza.  Opaque black in glass with two fingers of tan head that leaves great lacing down the pint glass.  Aroma of slight coffee, chocolate and caramel but nothing overpowering.  Nice flavor of dark chocolate and some roasted coffee with a little residual sweetness.  Body is moderate/full with nice soft mouthfeel and moderate carbonation.  Good example of a cream stout.  Easy drinking, especially at 6%.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Sharrett¬ís Liquor Store (Saint Paul, Minnesota, 25/11/12)
Chocolate, caramel, and coffee on the nose. Dark brown/black with a small tan head. Taste has a medium sweetness and a slight bitterness. Medium bodied, thick texture (for the style), average carbonation, and a bitter finish that seems a little out of place. Good, but not spectacular.

Wow, this beer is awesome!  Dark stout with great aroma and flavors of coffee, chocolate, hint of vanilla.  Nothing to overpowering and a soft carbonation that makes it go down smooth.  I am a lover of stouts and this is my kind of beer, a 6% that I could drink all day!

Pours almost black with small head. Has a light malt aroma with traces of chocolate. Light body for a stout. Good carbonation with slight bitter finish. Very refreshing stout. Will add to favorites.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark black, thin head. aroma of creamy milk, earthy notes. Sweet and creamy. Mid range body.
Aroma similar to Chocolate milk. Dark, brown almost black appearance. Fantastic smooth, creamy chocolate, malty taste. A must try!

Bottle. Pours a nice black color with a thick, bubbly tan head. Thick cocoa aroma with caramel in the background. Milky texture with some sweet chocolate notes. Really good, but not heavy. So a year round kind of stout.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2014 Dark brown, almost black pour with a half inch of creamy, dark brown head. Smells like thick cream, cocoa, and sweet cola syrup. Light creamy mouth feel, low carbonation. Very smooth blend of flavors: more sweet cream, smooth bitter rooty malt flavor that¬ís faintly licorice-like. Finish is tangy at first, but very very light, dry and slightly roasty. One of favorite beers that bells bottles. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle into a pint glass.

Pours pitch black with a thick two finger dark tan head. While the head does fade there is a constant thin cap over the beer throughout. Really nice lacing all the way around.

Dark chocolate, vanilla, and caramel immediately jump out at me in the aroma. There is definitely a healthy dose of roasted barley and chocolate malt in this. No hops detectable at all. This aroma is all malt.

Tons of roast right away in the flavor. Bitter bakers chocolate along with just a hint of vanilla and some caramel. There is almost a cappuccino-like quality to this although the coffee characteristics are quite faint. Some dark fruit floats around in the background and comes forward for a split second midway through the taste. No real hop flavor but lots of bitterness reminiscent of a good strong coffee or a piece of dark chocolate. Nice thick mouthfeel with a creamy sweetness.

Overall, an amazing stout for only being 6%. There is a ton of flavor packed into a small package in addition to excellent body. A great winter beer.
Very very smooth and well balanced. Slightly carbonated. Light chocolate,  coffee flavor with a smooth nutty finish.

Pours near black with tan head. The aroma is deep roasted grain near coffee like. The flavor is very smooth, creamy roasted grains with a light sweetness. Light anise like feel with a bittering roasted lingering effect. Simple smooth stout with full flavor.

Carbonated coffee flavor. Lots of roasted aroma and taste. Good but it great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very dark beer with thick almond head, similar to porter, complex flavors include coffee, caramel, and scorched popcorn. Smooth without being too bitter or harsh.

Pours black with quickly dissipating khaki head. Aroma is dominated by roasted malts and coffee, with a slight chocolate note. Taste starts sweet but quickly reveals some hop bitterness and finishes with strong roasted malt. Nice beer but nothing revolutionary. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours pitch black in color with a small tan head. Aroma is coffee, coco powder, chocolate, and a slight sweetness. The taste is very similar to the smell. Creamy mouthfeel, bitter dark chocolate, coffee, a hint of sweetness. The finish is bitter like bakers chocolate. Pretty good stout for a cold night.

2013.01.01 - Bell's Special Double Cream Stout - 12oz bottle in pint glass. Pours pretty dark, almost no head.  Aroma is mild roast.  Flavor starts with dilute roast flavor which gives way to creamy mild sweetness.   Pretty good.
A good stout to sip on a cold day. Not sure why it they call it a cream stout when not using any.

The aroma smells of the sweet horse sweat on a well worn saddle blanket. There is the initial bitter stout notes on the tongue, followed by a heavy, sweet creamy finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice for the end of a winter¬ís night. Smooth, creamy stout with flavors of chocolate, roasted malts, and coffee with a nice, mildly bitter coffee finish.

Molasses and plumb smell. Deep sweet molasses taste with plumb and dates. Bitter aftertaste. Still fairly dry. Very drinkable and balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.  Pours deep, dark brown with thin, creamy beige head; short retention and spare lacing.  Aroma is cocoa, milk chocolate, roasted malts, earthy hops, and plums.  Flavor is roast malt forward with dark fruit esters and cocoa notes; creamy mouthfeel that ends slightly dry.  Medium body and low carbonation.
Spices and malt are predominant . Tastes like winter. Not as overpowering as some stouts. Very drinkable

12 oz. bottle from The Party Source, Bellevue, KY. Served at cellar temperature and it still very weak nose of roasted chocolate malt. Good thing the flavor is nice.  Smooth creamy texture with a drying affect. Flavor is rich roasted malt, chocolate and sugar. Some light coffee nuances. Lactose sugar is used here without a doubt. This beer is one-dimensional but that one dimension is done really well. I¬íd love to try this on Nitro.
