I dont find this beer to be too sweet in the least, not sure this is much of a cream stout, but who cares, at 7.5% ABV and this taste, they could call it a shandy and i wouldnt care!  

2002 bottle.  Very strange yet good. Tons of black malt, oily, roasty, slightly bitter.  More like a porter this year, though surprisingly, the chocolate flavor is not sweet.  Quite bitter and lightly yeasty.  Different than the 2001, but still quite good.  

2003 bottle.  Wonderful it remains.  Some more roast than I remember, which is nice.  Good burnt flavor, like a s¬ímore without the marshmallow.  Nice chocolate flavor on the finish not overdone.  Much drier.  Great appearance, large dark oily brown head.  Maybe a touch of thinning as it warms.

Black color, tan lace.  Musty (like the corner of your basement), strong roast aroma.  Huge roasted flavors, some sweet malty notes in the finish.  Long.  This was the only brewery on my trip to offer tour and free samplers.  Class act brewery class act stout!

Very dark black color, with some good chocolate and coffee malt tones, mostly chocalte though.  I had it on tap at the brewery, and it was pretty sweet for a stout, but not really all that bad.  Well worth the try.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2008 Black; rich roast in the nose.  Slightly fatty body, light fruitiness (a function of the high gravity) - like cherries and grapes; long malty finish.  Soft, smooth, slightly creamy and a little bit nutty.  Kind of simple.
Black like tar.  Very imperial in taste.  The ratings for this beer are a bit over-the-top, I think.
pours black with diminishing tan head.  choclate and coffee nose. damn good stout but seems alot more like an imperial stout than a sweet or cream stout, but who cares its good
Very dark apperance.

Dark with orange/red hues. Head that died quick. Roasted nose with definite bittersweet,milky chocolate aromas as well. Smooth, bittersweet, roasty flavors with hints of smoke and wood? Decent hops and nice balance. Might be a nice intro to the world of Imperials. Thank you Psychprof.
Black, definitely black. Chocolate aroma. Full bodie, soft, very creamy maltiness, slightly roasty. rather sweet with balanced bitter finish. Loaded with flavours. Thanks PsychProf!

yummy!  this pours well with a thick cocoa head that stayed nearly the whole glass. Has a sweet/chocolate flavor, I swear I almost tasted (dark)chocolate covered cherries.  It¬ís medium bodied, and finished with a medium roast coffee flavor.  I love this brewers dark beers and dislike their lighter ones (anything lighter than their porter).  now I need to find their expedition stout........
A fine stout. Smooth, with a chocolate/coffee taste. Drank half and had the other half with chocolate ice cream. WOW!
Another fine beer from bells, I prefer this to the original, malty with hints of coffee and chocolate, very drinkable

Muddy brown with dark orange hues. Thin dark tan head. Moderate carbonation. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malts and oak (originally thought it was furniture polish). Light to medium body. Watery malts at first, but they take hold soon after. Sour oak barrel flavor rides the roasted bittersweet  chocolate and black malts. Light fruitiness and woody dryness round this out. Interesting.

Man do I hate dark beers.  But this crap was good as hell.  Strong so watch how fast and much you consume.  Slight coffee/chocolate flavor which was surprisingly smooth to me.  I did have about four other things before this though.
great!

Very smooth strong sweet stout.  This bber has an extremely nice thick mouthfeel, but is not cloying in any way.  The roastiness is balanced by some hops and the prescence of a very well done sweet maltiness.  Good stout.

Deep dark color, wonderful chocolate brown head and decent lace. Nose is full of chocolate aroma¬ís along with the wonderful toasted malts. The start is toasted chocolate malts, rich and creamy, the middle full, the finish slightly bitter sweet and dry. Quite a good stout, and one I will savor as this has been one ¬íSHIT¬í filled day.
I have only yet had this on a CO2 tap but it was still quite nice, for a stout. Sweet and creamy as the name implies. Not the same depth as some of their other stouts but nice.

My favourite of Kalamazoo¬ís stouts.  Intensely dark, nice coating mouthfeel, great complexity; chocolate, vanilla, coffee and smoky flavours.  This is one huge beer.  Goes great with vanilla ice cream.
Another very good stout.  Nice and creamy and tasty.
Great stout, very well rounded. This would have to be in my top 5 stouts

Dark color. Somewhat thin body with very little head. Strong coffee and bitter chocolate aroma. A coffee and bitter chocolate flavor that begins with a bit of hops, moves to a very, very smooth malty middle, and then to a slightly dry finish. A very good seasonal stout from bells.

So we had cans of Beamish, bottles of Anchor Porter, and this lovely stout - not a bad evening and the double cream held up well in the excellent company.  It¬ís sharp and roasty at first and sweetens and softens as it goes, perhaps too much as at the end I was left feeling a bit cheated, missing some of the complexity of the top notch stouts I¬íve had.

Behind that nondescript packaging that looks so unassuming on the store shelf (as if the design hadn¬ít been completed and they slapped on some temporary labels) is one of the best cream stouts you could ever hope to have. They call it special and it is, but it is also a marvelous everyday libation. What¬ís not to love?
Like drinking a roasted chocolate bar.Excellent a must try for stout lovers.

A friend from Chicago sent me a bottle of this brew, and I¬ím glad he did. True to its name, this is a creamy stout with a nice semi-sweet twang telling me its probably botte-conditioned. Worth buying if you see it.
I¬ím not a big fan of this kind of beer, but this stuff is very good!!

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2005 The name alone got me to drool. This beer is like a good chocolate malt, and goes great with chocolate covered pretzels. Normally I like a stout to warm up a little, but I love to get these ice-cold in a cooler and get the bottle nice and wet. I swear the best beer is brewed in Michigan, and stuff like this supports my case. The flavor is not totally over the top like Expedition Stout, but rich and creamy indulgence.

and here comes the spoiler.  Nice aroma and appearance, but falls short big time on flavor.  I keep waiting for a nice blast of warm maltiness but I get nothing but a weak hop tingle.  It won¬ít stop me from trying the other highly touted Bell¬ís brews.
This is an excellent stout.  Bell¬ís is one of the best breweries in the world!

mmm Double Cream Stout!  I used to be the anti-stout but lately I have grown to appreciate the finer aspects of stouts, and let me tell you this one has a ton of fine points.  If you have  access to this unique beer and you don¬ít pick it, you¬íre gonna be sorry. Good real good.
